result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth C Lesniewski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fail/Report to Jail (Misdemeanor), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.425(1r)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Kenneth C Lesniewski
parties.address: 112 N 3rd Avenue Room 16, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235

parties.name: Door County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Pay $100 fine plus costs, including Court-appointed attorney fees. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain full time employment if required by Dept. of Corrections.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.
Obtain AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations.

timeConds.notes: 35 days of sentence are stayed to be used at discretion of Court through petition by Dept. of Corrections. Huber privileges granted. 60 days to report.
Perform 10 hours of uncompensated community service for non-profit agency or organization.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Court grants credit for any time served. Huber release granted.
Concurrent with: 15-CM-157 and 16-CM-21
$100 fine plus costs.  If fine/costs not paid in full in 60 days, remaining balance will be converted to a civil judgment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kenneth C Lesniewski

defendant.name: Lesniewski, Kenneth C
defendant.address: 112 N 3rd Avenue Room 16, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235

records.descr: Amended Judgment of Conviction After Revocation

records.addlTxt: from defendant re: sentence credit.  Court responds:  Denied.  Sentence credits on each of these cases are correct.  Just because concurrent sentences were imposed at the same time doesn't serve to transform custody from one case to another. Each file involved a different course of criminal conduct on a different date. You have receive the appropriate credit in each file.  DTE

01:30 PM Defendant Kenneth C Lesniewski in court with attorney Sandra Jean Wagner.  Defendant Kenneth C Lesniewski in custody.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file, reviews sentence previously imposed.  State gives sentencing recommendation, makes statement.   Defense gives sentencing argument, requests time served sentence. Defendant makes statement. Court makes statement, imposes sentence.
1/5/19 letter to Judge and SPD Order Appointing Counsel
Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 9, 2019 at 02:00 pm.
from Atty Wagner re: representation for probation revocation

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: for 12 months to pay Court-ordered financial obligations

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Impose 35 days stayed conditional jail time for failing to report to agent and for failing to report to jail to serve conditional jail time.

Defendant Kenneth C Lesniewski in court with attorney Stephen Pleck Johnson. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charge, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest plea. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds Defendant guilty. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Bond no longer in effect.
Court appoints Stephen Johnson, orders Defendant to pay $100 per month starting 1/1/17
records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Defendant Kenneth C Lesniewski in court, in custody. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant presents Petition for Appointment of Counsel. Court reviews form, questions Defendant on income/expenses, appoints Stephen Johnson, orders Defendant to pay $100 per month starting 1/1/17.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 8, 2016 at 03:15 pm.

Defendant Kenneth C Lesniewski in court, in custody. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Johnson advises that Defendant was previously Court-appointed. Court questions Defendant, who completed paperwork. State suggests that Defendant probably qualifies for public defender. PD enters to talk to Defendant. Defendant does not qualify for PD. Court questions Defendant on his intentions regarding counsel. Petition given to Defendant.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 28, 2016 at 10:00 am.
To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving Justice Center.

Defendant Kenneth C Lesniewski appeared by video conference. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews issuance of warrant, charge, max. penalties, right to counsel. Court questions Defendant on what he wants to do about counsel. Defendant advises he already has counsel (Stephen Johnson). State advises that Defendant is on probation hold, has spoken with Agent, will not be released anytime soon.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 21, 2016 at 10:00 am.
